law.catch_line: The Board shall place a licensee on inactive status, if the licensee submits to the Board:...

section.section:
The Board shall place a licensee on inactive status, if the licensee submits to the Board:
An application for inactive status on the form required by the Board; and
The inactive status fee set by the Board.

The Board shall license an individual on inactive status who applies for a license if the individual:
Complies with the renewal requirements that exist at the time the individual changes from inactive status to active status; and
Meets the continuing education requirements set by the Board.
The Board may not require payment of a late fee by an individual as a condition to licensing under this paragraph.

text.section:
The Board shall reinstate the license of a psychologist who has not been put on inactive status and who has failed to renew the license for any reason if the psychologist:
Meets the renewal requirements of § 18-309 of this subtitle;
Pays to the Board a reinstatement fee set by the Board; and
Applies to the Board for reinstatement of the license within 5 years after the license expires.

The Board may not reinstate the license of a psychologist who fails to apply for reinstatement of the license within 5 years after the license expires. However, the psychologist may become licensed by meeting the current requirements for obtaining a new license under this title.
